title: Is our will a blessing or a curse? - Quora

response.answer_text: Hi, a bit of a ‘have to think about it’ question, really. I think that when we are very young, we had a much easier time of chasing it as a ‘blessing’. We were born into a world, which had been polluted by a thing called ‘the knowledge of good and evil . . . young mortals are a bit more separated from all the rules and laws that challenge their ‘innocence’. Adults more easily recognize it as the ‘Curse of the Law’. Those who know how to entertain that childlike wisdom of a purer heart, can hang on to the blessing part more easily. Those who have been exposed enough to the ‘Law’ part of it begin to learn how to respond in a multitude of ‘more bitter ways’ about it. It’s a ‘fickle’ kind of thing because what many are truly are missing (without realizing it) is that ‘passion’ almost always is bich whipped by ‘emotions’. Emotions are a damn strong thing. Our brains needs to use them because the brain itself was never created for bringing ‘answer’ of wisdom to anyone. Our ‘brain’ is nothing more than a ‘hard drive’ to store facts, and cold heartedly computes them. Wisdom can only come from a ‘pure’ heart and even though ‘religion’ and psychology, try to ‘picklock’ it: for truth / the brain just doesn’t have the ability to do it with much correctness. (It does however try to satisfy it), but most usually fails because of the ‘fireworks’ of emotions. I know . . . that answer also is sort of a ‘have to think about it’ too . . . answer. Hey, have a great day
